events.title: Indonesia Proclaims Independence
events.description: Indonesian nationalist leaders Sukarno and Mohammad Hatta declared Indonesia's independence from Dutch colonial rule.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of Indonesia's struggle for full sovereignty, leading to the eventual recognition of its independence.

events.title: Beginning of the Battle of Kursk
events.description: The Battle of Kursk began during World War II, involving a massive German offensive against Soviet forces in the Eastern Front.
events.significance: Known as the largest tank battle in history, the Soviet victory marked a decisive turning point in favor of the Allies on the Eastern Front.

events.title: Congo Gains Independence from Belgium
events.description: The Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville) officially gained independence after years of Belgian colonial rule.
events.significance: This was a major milestone in the decolonization of Africa, sparking political changes across the continent.

events.title: Fiji Constitution Suspended Following Military Coup
events.description: The military government suspended the constitution and dissolved parliament in Fiji following a coup d'état.
events.significance: This event reshaped Fiji's political landscape and raised questions about democracy and military power in the Pacific region.

events.title: First U.S. Navy SEALs Established
events.description: The United States Navy officially established the Navy SEALs (Sea, Air, and Land teams) as special operations forces.
events.significance: The creation of the SEALs marked a significant development in U.S. military capabilities and special operations.
